intro: Chorizema cordatum var. elegans, commonly known as the elegant heartleaf, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from purple to red, bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
